data.title: Adam Lambert Timeline
data.meta_description: Pre-Idol Media and Performances Under Construction - Please Don't Post Here
data.text:
Post by 4Ms on

atop.proboards.com/post/4000/thread

What's the big deal about Adam Lambert?

atop.proboards.com/post/4000/thread

Actually, Adam has many fine qualities. Adam is intelligent, eloquent, thoughtful, compassionate, generous and, well, you get the idea. He is, also, extraordinarily good looking and sexy as hell.

Most of his fans wouldn't know that about him, though, if they hadn't fallen in love with The Voice*, first.

*NBC totally stole this title for a singing competition program. ;D

Cassie's Vocal Masterclass* Threads:

Up and Running!

atop.proboards.com/index.cgi?board=vocal&action=display&thread=28

What note????

atop.proboards.com/index.cgi?board=vocal&action=display&thread=426

Our resident vocal expert, cassie*, offered these examples in answer to the question above and for Juneau and Xena's radio program:

A Beginner's Guide to Adam Lambert

1. Come to Me, Bend to Me - Brigadoon (Live)

The voice is pure heaven, the technique flawless, the emotion palpable, and the instrumentation sparse so the voice is front and center. 200% proof of the extraordinary voice.

2. Whole Lotta Love - Fantasy Springs Concert.

Need I say why?

3. Feeling Good - American Idol (Live)

Live or studio.

Recognized by many vocalists to be one of his best. Shows range, diversity, power, interpretation, technique.

4. Can’t Let You Go - FYE Album (Studio) — big rock song with insane technique.

Don’t know another singer out there who can sing that high and powerfully while singing actual WORDS. The few who can hit those notes do it with an open vowel sound, but can’t articulate lyrics. Also shows range of emotion from beginning to end.

5. My Conviction - Hair (Live)

For the “Shit! That can’t be Adam Lambert, can it???” factor.

6. Ring of Fire - American Idol (Live)

For originality of arrangement, turning a song on its head, blowing our minds and also, again, the technique behind it is extraordinary. Who sings like that? Very difficult to execute.

7. Heaven on their Minds - Broadway Unplugged (Live)

Rated by the rock guys at DDD as his best live performance.

(This video has the audio turned up.)

8. Mad World - American Idol (Live)

Idol live or studio. It’s the one he was most known for on the show, and the one that won him many new fans.

9. Soaked - Atlanta Concert (Live)

Soaked - Nashville Concert (Live)

Live acoustic. Often cited as having almost operatic vocals. Dynamic range great. Great emotional content.

10. Sleepwalker - Tonight Show With Jay Leno (Live)

Leno, or possibly Brisbane, which many fans consider the best version from his (GNT) tour.

Fierce. Wide range. Great emotional range.

My Note: I found Leno!!!

Now on to the business of this thread!
